intro: Disporum hookeri var. trachyandrum, commonly known as the rough-flowered disporum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. This variety is distinguished by its rough, textured flower stems and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
